text:
50cl Bottle @ LaBIRRAtorium, Madrid, Spain.
Brown colour with a thin white head.
Aroma is malt, caramel, spices, nuts, licorice.
Taste is malt, caramel, toffee, spices, licorice, raisins, hints of berries.
Medium to full body, average carbonation.
Aus der Flasche im Cathead in Gdansk getrunken. Cloudy reddarkbrown in the glass. In the nose wine-notes. Not so special, as I thought.

Piwo ma minimalna piane, troche osadu, barwe bordowo-brazowa. Slodkie, karmelowe, wyczuwalne jagody, kasztany przede wszystkim i orzechy laskowe w smaku. Zapach to wypieki piernikowe z marcepanem. Syropowata struktura, niskie wysycenie. Jak na przyprawowe piwo i w swieta OK, ale na codzien to nie koniecznie

Kolejne Nogne, które bardziej podchodzi pod BW. Słodkie, karmelowe, suszone, owoce, figi, przyprawy nieznacznie wyczuwalne - nie psują na szczęście całości. Momentami przełamane przez umiarkowanie wyczuwalne akcenty owoców leśnych, które lekko kontrują podbudowę słodową. Solidne piwo, niczego nie urywa, nie jest przełomowe. ABV dobrze ukryte, pijalność wysoka, wysycenie niskie. Na pewno przypadnie do gustu miłośnikom klasycznych angielskich BW, jak i fanom Nogne.
Bottle. Lots of apples, some plums, some spices, all rather completely mixed together. Watery with light body, sweet. Too high carbonation. Ok-ish.

Ar: Deep fig and raisin, aroma of some oxidized caramel malts; some dark caramel. Ap: Murky brown; minuscule light tan head with low retention, leaves a very thing ring of mostly very fine bubbles. T: Lots of dark fruit--fig and prune; hints of rosemary, cinnamon, and spruce; fair amount of sweetness throughout; some light herbal hop notes; burnt caramel and more fig on the finish. P: Medium-full body with medium carbonation; finish is medium-dry. O: Sweetness and body are appropriate for a winter warmer, with some nice spice hints; however, the oxidized caramel flavors really mask the spices and create an unfocused beer, overall.

Brown colored with a red hue, thick, small tan creamy head. Aroma is of malt and caramel, syrupy, toast, dried fruit, nutty, spices. Taste is medium to very sweet malt and caramel, candy sticky, dried fruits, spices, toast, light+ bitterness, bit nutty, sweet finish. Medium to full bodied, soft- carbonation, sticky. Too sweet but still very nice.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, dried fruit, juniper berries and spices.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque red/dark brown with heavy yeast and with a slight/

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, dried fruit and juniper berries; ends slightly dry with spices.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. I like the flavour of juniper, so this is simply great for me. Together with that amazingly thick palate and a great appearance, only the aroma is slightly lacking.
From bottle. Pours hazy brown. Nose of treacle, junipers, woody, nutty. Taste is marzipan, spices, more berries, full bodied with a smooth, sweet finish.

Bottle @ Køge øldag w senior & friends/the chef. Appearance: pours clear brown with good soapy beige head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, nuts, juniper, spices and some fruity notes. palette: strong malty and medium spicy 
aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average to long duration and an oily texture. Overall:very nice spiced ale/seasonal
Godt og fyldig, men veldig søt. God som dessertvin. Nytes best I begrensede mengder.
Tikkeltje muf. Met hazelnoten en cacao en ook een zoete smaak die kruidig aan kandijkoek doet denken Mooi vol

Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket. Aroma is sweet malt, caramel, strong spicy notes, mild juniper, nuts, touch of dried fruits. Flavour is sweet and mildly bitter. Body is just above medium. Sweet and spicy, nice winter warmer.

0,5l bottle shared. Appearance: brown body, with a small off white nice compact head. With a good retention.
Aroma: Spices, liquorice tones, dark fruits, chestnuts, berries, light raisins. 
Taste: Sweet and spicy,Liquorice tones, spices, light coffee, berries,caramel and rasisins.Finish is light roasty with a lot of spices. 
full body, slightly below average carbonation, silk texture.

The aroma is of berries, spices and overripe fruit. The taste is the same and actually perfectly balanced for this beer. The beer does not get better without losing the taste a little later. No good bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth a weak moment. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours really nice in dark brown with medium brown head and a nose that is rich with chestnut and toffee malts. Taste is s2eet

Luke 15 adventskalender 2016. Flaske kjøpt på Vinmonopolet Jekta Tromsø. Aroma krydder, mørk malt, sjokolade, mørk frukt. Utseende mørk brun med beige skum som forsvinner fort. Smak krydder, malt, humle, melkesjokolade, litt alkoholsmak. Søtlig, fyldig og kraftig juleøl med julestemning. Veldig godt øl.
From tap at Taphouse. Pours brown with a small white head. Aroma is dominated with sweet and almost wet malts and spice. Taste is sweet with sweet malts with juniper and caramel nice.

Bottle at home (brewed 7/7-14, batch 1223). Pours murky reddish brown, with almost no head. Aroma of juniper, sage, milk chocolate, nutty, light roasted malts, caramel. Taste is over moderate sweet, moderate bitter, milk chocolate, juniper, roasted malts, nutty, sage, bitter milk chocolate and juniper aftertaste. Nice.

pours unclear medium dark brown-red with a nice reviving mediumd ark beige cap offering good retention and lacing. very fruity - lots of peppery berries and caramel, but also very spicy - sage but also potent rosemary; sweetness - oversweetened cranberry sauce; other spices and astrinent herbs, warming spicy alcohol. moderately low carbonation, medium body - oily and thick; sweet if not cloying über-spicy finish. an opulent (if not cloying) christmas-like brew with slightly awkward ingredient blend all together.

Bottle
Aroma-spices, chilli, herbs
Appearance-brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, spicy
Palate-medium body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

500 ml bottle. Pours chestnut brown with an off-white head. Herbal aroma with sage and thyme. Full body and heavily sweet with brown sugar, chocolate, vanilla and spices. Pretty heavy but an excellent one.

0,5l from bottle. bottled 24.06.2015. brown color, small off white head. smells of spices, peppery, dark fruits, light raisins. ok smell. full body, slick mouthfeel. tastes of licorice, spices, light coffee, lightly fruity, caramel. finishes lightly roasty, with notes of licorice and spices. Okish, but not very special

Ekstrakt:  22% wag. 
 Dodatki:  Biała szałwia, kminek, owoce jałowca, kasztany. 
 Kolor:  Rubinowy. Pod światło liczne czerwonawe refleksy. Silna opalizacja. 
 Piana:  Żółta, drobnopęcherzykowa, przechodząca w średnie oczka.
Zwarta warstewka tworząca jedną całość. Piana średniotrwała. Utrzymuje się przez jakiś czas. Na ściankach malują się barwne obrazki. Pokaźna oponka nad piwem. 
 Zapach:  Umiarkowanie mocny słodkawy zapach. Początkowo delikatna czekolada, trochę kawy Cafe Latte. Z oddali dochodzą przyprawowo-ziołowe nuty - trochę jałowca i kasztany. Dość specyficzny zapach, ale na tyle lekki, że nie zaburza całościowego odbioru. 
 Smak:  W smaku na pierwszy ogień idą słody. Przede wszystkim zaznacza się czekolada deserowa, która wykleja usta swoją słodyczą. Po chwili do kubków smakowych dociera smak jałowca, lekkie kasztanowe sugestie i coś bardziej ziołowego - to może być szałwia. W oddali ciemne owoce - śliwki, ciemne winogrona, rodzynki.
Goryczka silnie zaznaczona, średniej długości.
Finisz półwytrawny. Półpełna tekstura, umiarkowane ciało.
Lekko rozgrzewające nuty alkoholu.
Pijalność nienajgorsza, chciaż myślałem że będzie większa. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Bardzo oryginalna propozycja jeśli chodzi o Piwo Świąteczne. Ze szczególnym wskazaniem na dość nietypowe dodatki: kasztany, kminek.
W segmenie piw Holiday Ale dość ciekawie wypada.
Słodki profil piwa z nutami czekoladowymi, owocowymi, a także ziołowymi.
Warte spróbowania dla poszukiwaczy nowych smaków w piwach craftowych.

Aromas of sugared pumpkin, apricot, sweet malts, sweet licorice, coriander, nougat and star anise. Pours brownish black with a massive brown foam and lacing. Taste brings sweet pumpkin, brown sugar, baked yams, sweet potatoes, licorice, star anise and cinnamon. Finishes sweet with cinnamon spice and pumpkin. Overall, this is delicious, very sweet and flavorful, Like a liquid snickerdoodle cookie with pumpkin.

Draught at KØ16. Fruity berry aroma. Cloudy dark amber colour. Small creamy off-white head. The flavour is sweet and sugary with a vinous touch and more berry. Herbal finish. Tastes good, but on the sweet side.

Butelka 0,5l Kolor ciemnobrązowy, przebłyski rubinowe, piana piękna kremowa średnio trwała.Aromat ziół i słodów w smaku słodkie, suszone owoce i zioła. Goryczka niska, alkohol ukryty, bardzo dobre piwo. Generalnie bardzo smakowite piwo.

Copenhagen 23/4 2016. 50 cl bottle from Meny. Some beduins riding their camels on holiday in silhouette on the label. Pours hazy brown with off-white head. Settles as 0,5 cm thick layer of foam. Sweet aroma of caramel and fermented dark fruits. A little boozy. Softt carbonation and thick creamy palate. Taste is quite sweet and a bit sugary. Followed by light to medium bitterness in aftertaste. Tasty and intense in a very sweet and boozy way. Probably not what I would drink on my holiday - unless it was a Ski holiday where I would need my cough syrup.
Bottle. Dark brown pour. Special aroma of ginger, juniper, spices, nuts and malt. Spicey flavor of juniper, ginger, anise-ish spices, malt and a subtle nut flavor. Creative and nice.

Piana kremowa, szybko opada do pierzynki. Barwa herbaciano rubinowa. Aromat intensywny, słodki, słodowy, czuć przyprawy, zioła, kandyzowane owoce, rodzynki i miód pitny. W smaku fajnie zbalansowane, bardzo treściwe, gęste, wbrew zapachowi nie jest to ulepek, raczej półsłodkie, lekko wyklejające. Oczywiście prym wiodą daktyle, suszone owoce, przyprawy korzenne, palony karmel, miód spadziowy. Goryczka niska do średniej, ziołowo palona. W afterteasie długie mineralne posmaki oraz odrobina szałwii i jałowca. Mimo pikantnego finiszu nie czuć alkoholu. Nagazowanie niskie, oleiste, lepkie i gładkie.
Świetna interpretacja piwa świątecznego, może nieco zbyt przyprawowa w smaku, ale sama konsystencja i aromat to mistrzostwo świata. Taki angielski Barley Wine na sterydach.

Dziwne cuś. Orzechowe posmaki, ziołowość, trochę jagód i owocowych estrów. Wszystko z prawie 9% alko którego w ogóle nie czuć. Zaskakująco pijalny bezstylowiec, któremu najbliżej chyba do christmas ale.

W aromacie czuć siną przyprawowość, na początku imbir (którego w składzie nie ma!), jałowiec, po chwili bardziej korzennie, poparte jest to quasi belgijskim drożdżowym sznytem i ciasteczkową słodowością. W smaku bardzo podobnie, piwo jest stosunkowo pełne, ale nie słodkie, silnie przyprawowe, bardzo złożone, trudne do rozbicia na poszczególne elementy, a do tego świetnie pijalne. Brakowało jednego czynnika, takiej wisienki na torcie sprawiającej, że zapamiętałbym je na zawsze. Świetna interpretacja piwa świątecznego.

Old rating rerated 01.12.2915, 0,5l bottle (first batch #440, bbd. 27.07.2014) shared with friends @ home:
7-4-8-4-15
Soft gusher. Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry spiced, grass, minerals, weeds, sage, juniper berries, dark sugar, caramel, alcohol, bark. Taste is slightly sweet spiced, grass, juniper berries, minerals, dark sugar, sage, weeds, caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice.

Ölföreningen 2015. Smak och doft av trä, karamell, salvia, kastanj, anis, katrinplommon, lagerblad, torkad aprikos och enbär. Rund och len, stor sötma, stor kropp, oljig, välbalanserad med fin beska. Mums!
50 cl. bottle. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavout of malt, caramel, spice, fruit, chocolate and sweet.
5/10/2010 10:59:22 PM Bottle from Whole Foods Hadley. Brown colour with tall head. Spicy nose with ginger. Taste is also spicy, herbal. With lots of juniper flavours. Pretty good. But not great.

Bottle. Spicy noose, with cinnamon, cola, chocolate, and sugar. Dark translucent brown, dark tan head, some lace. Initial is quite sweet, then some light chocolate, dark fruit, and a hop/spice blend in mid palate and finish. Thick, oily, oat smoothness, and low carbonation. Maybe two years old. Unusual nose. Flavors are so-so, Very smooth palate.
Bottle share. Strong ale characteristics, some spice. Mild pour, huge aroma, spicy taste. Cinnamon, nutmeg, normal holiday flavors.

31-DEC-2015, bottle @home, from Boxbeers.
Dark Brown with a low tan head. Sweet roast, spice, ginger, brunkage. Soft carbonation, full body, sweet. Too spicy and too sweet for me. Well made but too much.
Interesting peppermint flavor and scent. Barley, leather, mint, cocoa,coconut and has a halls flavor too. Dark brown almost black. Tap

A dark brown body with a minimal head. Nose has loads of cardamom, juniper, rye, clove and cinnamon. Taste is quite sweet with a lingering spicy bitter finish. Minimal carbonation and extremely thick palate, almost like jello and water mixed together. Quite warming as well. This is barely a beer in my books but really quite drinkable despite being pretty extreme. Reminds a bit of a spicy sahti.

Bottle bbe 16.06.2019. Aroma malty, molasses, vinous, some spices. Taste sweet, some herbal taste similar to fernets, chocolate. Finishes malty sweet and slight herbal notes. The herbal notes are not quite to my liking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a veiled ruby reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is wood, hazelnut, chocolate and fruit. Flavor is pine tree, hazelnut, menthol, fresh. Finish is red berries, hazelnut, caramel, milk chocolate. Lingering fruits and fresh spices. Full body, soft, velvety mouthfeel and weak to average carbonation.

Draught at Taphouse, København. Murkey brown - offwhite head. Spicy. Sweetness. Caramel. Roasted malts. Light fruity. Light bitterness. Forrest. Juniper - pine like notes. Some chocolate. Far too sweet.
Bottle from the rotbox. Nose is huge with light tropical fruit and mango. Light oxidation. Deep reddish brown and minimal head. Taste is very oxidized and bad. Papery. Bleh

27.12.2015. 0,5l Bottle. Vinmonopolet Haugesund. Dark Amber colour with tan head. Very thick with heavy oily texture. High viscosity liquid stuff. Ok. Very rich with lots of malty flavours together with a decent level of alcohol. Rich with aromas of dark malts, Chocolate and maybe some vanilla. Pretty sweet. Strong. Sharp malty flavours. Aftertaste is malty with soft bitterness with alcohol strength and malt sweetness. Very nice beer!

Bottle (500 ml). Split 2-ways. Dark reddish-brown with a small tan head leaving little lacing. Aroma is nutty forward with berries, caramel, bread and spices. Taste is not much sweet and alcohol is well hidden for the abv, but the spices takes a bit too much place and the body isnt strong enough to compensate. Theres berries, nuts and caramel, like in the aroma, alongside a mild acidity. Medium body, but it felt a bit thin. Moderate to medium carbonation. Gentle tart finish with a lingering nutty presence. Its far from horrible, but still rather disappointing considering its a collaboration between three world-class breweries. It lacks of balance and body. The ingredients representing the there parts of the world where each brewer come from doesnt work that well together either. Low drinkability.

Mintha csak az Underlig Jul és God Jul házasítása lenne, a Nøgne Ø kollaborációs söre remekül vegyíti azt a könnyed és friss fűszerességet, mely az előbbi ital sajátja, továbbá azt a gazdag, testesebb karaktert, ami leginkább a másodikként említett főzet erejét adta. Gyömbéres illatokkal nyit, melyek akkor válnak igazán egyértelművé, miután az összetevők között megpillantjuk a zsálya nevét - ha máshonnan nem, a szopogatós cukorkák világából ugyanis ismerősen csenghet a karakter receptoraink számára. Pajkos illatai folyékony halmazállapotukban krémes, telt jegyekben elevenednek meg, a bogyós gyümölcsök hangulata, így például valamiféle feketeribizlis benyomás, de egy sokrétű belga élesztős, mazsolás és fűszeres szövevény is meghatározó jellegét adják az ünnepi italnak.
Bottle 50 cl, shared with Erik Larsson. Aroma of spices, malt and rasin. Bitter taste with a warm spices end.
Aroma of malt, caramel, raisins and spices (heavy). Taste is the same but sweet malt and chocolate. Its ok for a christmas beer but not really among my favourites.

Dark brown clearish. Medium carbonation. Not too intense aroma, but I get some rich malts, chocolate, and nuts in there. Kinda smokey, but I dont think there is any smoke. Very sweet, but with a good balance from the bitter roasted malts. A nice hint of sourness as well. Rich creamy body, like drinking silk.  Very complex. Nuts, caramel, roasty, touch of dates. Finishes with the bitter juniper berries.  Simply, this is a great winter warmer. Perfect for a cold night indoors. Id better get a few more bottles, theres a lot of winter left.

Dark chestnut color with light brown head. Aroma has sweet malts, pumpkin pie spices and some dark fruits. Taste starts a bit sweet and spicy with dark fruits like figs and dates, caramel and nuts. Overall its very balanced for a spiced ale. Body is quite heavy with low carbonation. Overall I think this is one of the better Christmas beers I tried this year.

Flaska från demolenbeershop drucken med ölföreningen. Jag minns stonevarianten som kryddig med väldigt mycket enbär, men lite platt för sina 9%. Det här var något helt annat. Väldigt sött, tjockt och kryddigt, framför allt med anis och lakritsrot men också lite lagerblad och enbär. Smakar läkerol, bröstkaramell och söt kryddig snaps. Funkar faktiskt riktigt bra. Gott.

Aroma and taste is medium roasted malty with some prominent seasonal spices throughout, lots of cardamom, cinnamon, ginger, nutty, some caramel and chocolate sweetness in there as well, all in all an interesting enjoyable seasonal brew.

Nøgne Ø / Jolly Pumpkin / Stone Special Holiday Ale a nice seasonal brew. Dark brown pour with tight off-white head. The sage dominates the aroma but there is a slight smokey quality. Taste is a touch too spicy and a touch too sweet but very good overall with those smokey notes coming through. Not something you want to drink all the time, but a nice reminder of the season.

Mørkt rødbrunt med fint cafe latte farget skum. Mørk karamel, skogbunn og lett kaffe i duften. Kjenner både einer og kastanjer i smaken sammen med en myk kaffesmak. Fyldig karamell i en lang avslutning. Alkoholen er tilstede på en god og varm måte.

50 cl, bottle conditioned. Batch #1453A, brewed June 15th 2015. Nice dark ruby colour, very thin tan head, nice rolling carbonation. Very pleasant, mild spicy aroma. Yes, its christmas time, beyond all doubts... Mouthfeel is rather thick, sweet and syrupy, low carbonation. Flavourwise, to me, its way too sweet. Its very spicy, but I would prefer a bit more malt and hop flavours coming through to balance out all that sweetness. A bit disapointing.
Alla spina. Curiosa ale di concezione "invernale" che offre un cocktail dolciastro di malto, zenzero, cacao, lievito e frutta matura. Finale amarognolo ed equilibrato, corpo medio. Piacevolissima!
Deep brown with a reddish tinge. Aroma is ginger, slight herbs, slight cardamom. Taste is spices, ginger, slight cocoa.

Dark brown in colour with a nice large latte creamy head. Aroma of ginger, cinnamon, all spice, roasted malt, molasses, and nuttiness. Did get the sage and this beer really smelled like a mix of Christmas cake and ginger biscuits. Taste had tons of cinnamon, clove, all spice, ginger, and nuttiness in the front, which leads on to strong notes of toffee, caramel, and molasses on the back. Big backbone notes of roasted malt, caramel, and molasses with spices after the finish. Medium body

.5l bottle @ Hannikus cave. Pours black with nice thick tan head. Aroma is sage, malts, clover, rye, bread, peppermint, spices, alcohol, medicin herbs. Flavor is dark malts, coffee, herbs, sage, dark chocolate, clover and alcohol. Herbal! Complex beer but quite nice.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma is spiced with some fruitier components and roasted malt. The flavour has sweetness, roasted malts, spices, stone fruits, and a dry spiced finish. Actually quite well-rounded for a beer with a lot of adjuncts.

shared by Konfuzzi, thank you! Sweetish arome with a lot of white sage and juniper, with some alcohol heat and a Jägermeister/self-made Blutwurzelschnaps tang to it, also some vanilla notes; herbs, oak and vanilla in taste, on a caramel-malt basis; special but somewhat disparate.

Bottle 50cl @Freiburg Tasting session. A dark beer with low head. Nose is a balanced between chocolate and floral / spicy notes. Aroma is floral, fruity, ginger, dark malt notes, lot of herb and spices, sweets, herbal, light redberries.

(Batch 1223, brewed 7/7/2014).
Appearance: Medium dark coffee brown with a beige head.
Nose: Freshly baked white bread, coriander, oranges, caramell. Some clove and ginger too.
Taste & appearance: Semi sweet, quite rich and full bodied. Not very much carbobation but with a creamy feeling to it. Quite "Christmas spicy" taste but on the right side, staying far away from any overly sweet Christmas cake associations. Keeps fresh all the way through the taste curve and finishes with a discreet bitter note to round off any remaining sweetness. 
Well made and well balanced beer, taking into consideration all the extra ingredients. And different!

(Batch nr : 1223. BB 7/7-18. Brygget : 7/7-14. 50 cl) Jai bien aimé cette bière épicée, les rois trois rois mages apportent chacun des ingrédients différents, des épices. Cette bière est douce, chaleureuse, réconfortante, gouleyante. Légèrement sucrée mais jamais lourde. Une belle offrande pour le petit Jésus.
Dont like the sage in beer, somehow too spicy. Dark amber coloured and clear. Has an off-white head. Aroma is sweet and spicy. Flavor too.

500 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. No date or batch number on the label but probably 2013, bought in October 2013. Dark brown with half a finger of light tan head. Aromas of spices, cola, dark fruit. Tastes of dark fruit, spices, light herbs, caramel. Medium body with a dry finish. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel.

(Batch nr : 1223. BB 7/7-18. Brygget : 7/7-14. 50 cl) Une bière brune ou rougeâtre ou orange brûlée ou même ambrée : je narrive pas à me décider. Un col formé par la force du versement : on dirait bien que les bulles ne sont pas au rendez-vous. Au nez, cest malté en sil-vous-plaît. Cest aussi épicé et floral. Je narrive pas à identifier précisément les parfums qui émanent de cette potion. Il y a une caravane Berbère sur létiquette. Jai limpression que cest un signe. Mes papilles reconnaissent beaucoup de douceur dans cette première gorgée. Il y a aussi des épices : elles sont africaines ou orientales? En bouche, voilà un liquide très huileux et assez lourd. Labsence de bulles naide pas à alléger lappareil. En arrière-goût, les épices et des herbes infusent les malts sucrés qui rendent ma langue et mes lèvres bien collantes.

Wow! The aroma surprises with some serious clove and malty background. The taste gives pretty much what the aroma promises. Tasty! Color is hazy brown, beige head. Body is full and round. Very little carbonated. A very good and exotic beer!

7th May 2015Murky brown - amber beer, small pale tan head. Palate is silky smooth and and slightly viscous. Rich creamy malts. Strong but cooling smooth cinnamon. Trace of dark fruits. Smooth finish. Its a notably mellifluous spice beer but a little one dimensional.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head leaving spotty lacing. The aroma is bready malt, caramel, and raisin. Thin mouth with sweet malt, light roast, chocolate, good.
gan velniai subalansuotas tamsus stiprus alus su viskiais prieskoniais. kalėdinis tsakanc,,,,

500 ml bottle from notes. Pours a clear bright mahogany color with a medium sized creamy beige head. The aroma is heavy with juniper and spices. There is an overall sweetness from the malts and a slight nuttiness. The flavor has juniper notes, spices and moderately sweet malts. A dry earthy bitterness comes through toward the finish. Medium to medium plus body. The flavors all work pretty well together for an interesting brew. Probably a notch better than the Stone version.

50cl bottle from Vinmonopolet, Sandaker. Pours hazy caramel brown with a rather modest off-white head. Spicy aroma with dark malt, lots of caramel, herbs and juniper. Very sweet, very flavourful and very tasty. Certainly a nice winter warmer if you like sweet and herbal beers. Quite delicious!

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2015 Sampled from a bottle - thanks Jan!. Batch number 1150. Dark wood colour, with sparse head. Rich, spicy aromas and very rich, complex taste. Wonderful festive taste of juniper, liquorice, caramel, orange and sage all in perfect harmony. A remarkably successful brew, this beer is one to be treasured.
A wonderful Christmas beer.

Tasting another bottle - batch number 1453- still superb! Rich, full, fruity, spicy and utterly delicious!
2014(?) bottle at home. Poured a clear dark brown with no head. Fair amount of bubbles. The nose had malted candy, glühwein with minor notes of mint and cinnamon. Still tastes good!
UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 How: Bottle Appearance: Hazy brown, off- white head. Aroma: Caramel, spice, nuts, herbs, chocolate. Palate: medium to full body, low carbonation.

50cl Bottle from Sterk Avondverkoop. Brown colour, beige head. Aroma reminds me of gale, must be the caraway then, caramel, some juniper in the distance, very herbal and medicinal. Flavour is very spicy, caraway, gale, juniper, caramel, quite sticky, sweet, tiny bit of liquorice, firm herbal bitter finish. Medium-bodied, slick. Cough syrup. Good, but 50cl became cloying halfway through.
Very intense spicy aroma. Pours a dark warm brown colour without head. Almost no carbonation. Very spicy woody flavour.
Bottle. What a beer! Tastes of walnut and sage as the label says, yes, but also of mint, cumin and cinnamon. A crazy but interesting brew!

Mørk brun farge med beige fint skum. Lukten preges veldig av ingefær, men også karamell, malt. Fyldig. Med den krydrete lukten, så kjenner man den hele veien. Ikke helt som forventet men likevel en god "juleøl".
500ml bottle as a gift. Spicy nose, cinnamon, orange. Malty, sweet body with a well balanced amount of christmas spices.
500ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Raisins, carraway, malt, caramel and juniper in the aroma. Fruity, spicy and sweet taste with raisins, caramel, rye, carraway and juniper.

500ml bottle. Clear, dark mahogany colour, ruby red glimmer, with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, tan head. Spicy, dark malty aroma, a touch of malt lozenge and treacle, sage, laurel, juniper berries, mustard seed, caraway, already a good deal of sweetness advertised. Taste is sweet dark malty, notes of treacle, molasses, rather unspecific spiciness; very oily, viscous texture, soft and slightly sticky palate.

Draught @ Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Dark brown colour, off-white foamy head. Herbal (!) nose and taste along with liquorice, cough syrup. OK finish. Watery body, medium carbonation. Not my taste, but well executed spiced ale.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Litt disig Karamellfarget. Medium skumtopp. Moderat karbonert. Smaker karamell, krydder, honning, furunål og mørk frukt. Dette ølet er svæææært fornøyelig

Bottle - Pours cola color with a thin tan ring of head. Nose is ginger, with light dry bread and a little nuttiness. Taste is the same--honey, ginger, dry bread, and not much else. Mellow body with smooth carbonation.

0,5l bottle,2014. Dark brown,caramel head. Of all my ratings so far,the most distinct beer. Heavy scent of spice. Sage, chestnut, like a spicy schnapps. Good balance between sweet and sour, albeit a bit on the sour side. Lacks bitterness. Overpowering spicy perfume. Very interesting,but not the most friendly taste. I admire this ones courage.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 Bottle at home. Pours copper to dark ruby with small off-white head. Aroma of honey, spices (sage, clove), herbs, liquorice. Sweet taste with some harshness; spices, dried dark fruits and herbs, with sage dominating. Smooth mouthfeel. Bittersweet, herbal aftertaste.
Keg at Beer Temple, 19th December 14. This is sweet and medicinal, not my sort of beer at all, creamy sweet flavour, weird spiciness.

Bottle 50 cl.</br>
Hazy dark amber, off-white head. Malty spiced aroma. A Christmassy cocktail of ginger, cardamom and cinnamon. Medium sweet, dry bitter finish and long aftertaste.
Smakt hjemme i ølglass. Lukter lakris, smaker mye lakris. Litt for mye. Veldig god i munnen. Passer til riskrem og karamellpudding.

50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy dark brown with a beige head. A lot of different aromas and tastes in this one. Bread, citrus, sweetness, spices, alcohol, cardamom/ginger, and so on. Really good and interresting beer.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aromas of spice, sage, roasty, bready malts with a touch of dark fruits. Mouthfeel is slick and amazing with plenty of flavor. There is so much here, its almost hard to put your fingers on, but i get spices, nutmeg, cloves, nuts, sage, dark malts, dark fruits, and ginger. Its amazing in every way. This is an outstanding beer.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy dark brown with a ring of tan head. Aroma and taste of spice and sweetness and malts.
Flaska inköpt i Oslo. Brunröd vätska. Doft av citrus, ingefära och hostmedicin. Ganska hög sötma där ingefäran tydligt framträder i smaken också. Nästan lite munvatten-varning.

Appearance: Brown, clear. Some light tan head.
Aroma: Prunes, malt.
Taste: Sweet, prunes, spices. Some dark malt.
Bought: OSL tax-free, 500 ml, NOK 65.00
Info: 7/11-2014, BB: 27/3-2018

Sample at Nordic Brew 2014, Fredrikshavn, Denmark. Hazy deep amber/brown beer with a small offwhite head. Spicy aroma, coriander, citrus, ginger notes, some caramel. Spicy flavor, coriander, ginger, chocolate notes. A bit too spicy for me.

Bottle of 2013-edition, batch 1023, shared with BHK 09.11.14. Very dark copper. Dense and persistent beige head and lacing. Aroma of toffee, dark berries and strong wine. Similar taste, with evident sage. Fine and mild aftertaste, alsmost with a hint of anise or bitter liquorice.
On tap beer temple. Svart med offwhite skum. Aroma av krydder og gjær. Smak av krydder gjær og malt. Søt. Medium co2

Bottle. Dark copper brown, medium head. Sweet, nutty and spicy nose, hints of prunes. Sweet, but well-balanced in the mouth. Good bitterness from the junipers and chestnuts, I suspect. Great seasonal brew.

Draft at beer temple. Pours brown with a tan head. Aroma of big spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, pumpkin coming out, cola, dark fruit, light veggies. Flavour is over moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Mouthfeel like chewy cola. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Poured a deep reddish brown with a dense tan head. Aroma of spicy pumpkin. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet pumpkin, lightly bitter.
Bottle - Spicy malts, toffee and some cocoa. Deep maroon with a rich beige head. Malty, spice and some dark fruit. Sweet and spicy.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear amber brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy caramel, berries and lots of christmas spices. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish. Sticky. 240914

Bottle @ Christers. Pours dark amber with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, heavy x-mas spice, little caramel, light fruitnote. Flavor is malt, caramel, bitterness, light juniper, heavy spice. Medium body, soft carbonation, dry light bitter finish. 240914

Bottle. Clear dark amber/brown with small beige head. Aroma is malt, caramel, toffee, spices, berries, chocolate and juniper. Flavour is malt, caramel, spices, berries, herbs, medium sweet, chocolate, hop, little toffee and a medium bitter.

Bottle at home from drinkstorepours hazy dark brown with lazy fobbing from bottle forming a fluffy mid tan head. Rich caramel and nutty aroma with a herbal undertone. Fairly dry, the rich chestnut flavour I associate with beers of this type (though probably only pick up on it because i know its there). Dry herbal notes in finish but sage not identifiable particularly. Not much coming in from the Juniper either. But very smooth, full bodied but not hot, well made beer.

Fourth release. Brown pour with a few bubbles but no head. The aroma has some toffee, juniper and cherry notes. The flavor is a bit different. The raisin and cherry character mixes with some toffee, leather, tobacco and chocolate. Medium mouthfeel and low to no carbonation.

Poured from a 2-9-13 bottle into a snifter. Aroma is of chestnut and maple. Appearance is a cloudy maple brown with a small tan head that dissipates slowly. Taste is unlike other holiday beers in that it is not overly spiced and has a nice caramel nutty flavor. Palate is very good with a pleasant level of carbonation. Overall my favorite holiday brew and amongst my favorites overall. I highly recommend this. Cheers.

Poured from a bottle into a snifter mahogany with a thin head.
Aroma is spicy boozy some hops?
Flavor is exceptional. Not a huge winter warmer fan but could sip this on a cold night easily. Juniper there as well as the nutty flavor. Brown sugar is just right and the spice simply moderate. Best winter warmer I have ever had-PERIOD~Excellent!!
Bottle. Brown with a small head. Spicy with a medium body. Not a lot of impact considering its strength but still worth trying. Definitely a Christmas/ Winter ale.

Bottle. Pours a dark brown with quickly fading head and slight lacing. The aroma is huge, with holiday spices and pine at the onset. Nutmeg, cinnamon, juniper, and ginger notes. Flavor is complex, spicy sweet, and overpowering. Rum-spiked wassail with a cinnamon stick in front of the tree on Christmas Eve. Thin to medium bodied.
Bottle at home. This is excellent, sweet and malty, toffee, some aniseed, light spices, hint of juniper.

Berries, spices, nuts and a hint of coffee in the aroma. Dark brown with a red tint and a beige head. Medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body with average carbonation. Overall a interesting, complex and rich ale.
Nice brew that comes together well to highlight juniper berries more than the other elements. Light sense of nut as well. Light sweet finish, soft carbonation. Tap at Churchkey.

Shared by Mick, 2009 bottle of the Special Holiday Ale. A nutty brown pour, with a thin filmy beige head. A spicy nose of juniper & spices. Smooth medium bodied beer with a nice flavor of sage, juniper, spices, nuts & malts very pleasant.
At BBF. Hazy brown colour with beige lacing. Fruity, spice aroma. Sweet, malty, caramel and spice taste. Medium body.
From tap @ BBF 2014. Pours dark amber with a moderate beige head. Aroma is sweet, candy, some aromatic hearbs. Flavor is sweet, again some aromatic hearbs, caramel.

On tap at Barcelona Beer Festival 2014. I think its this version. Dark red color. Thin head. Sticky body. Medium to high sweetness. Medium bitterness. Low sourness. Aroma is fruity, caramel, herby, woody.
Wunderbares Piwo mit diversen Kräuternuancen, dazu etwas Honig und Beeren. Sehr süffig, sehr trinkbar, dazu wundervoll aromatisch. Fein.

Bottle from trade with Meilby - many thanks! The beer pours out in a deep black colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of malt, barley and spices. Taste of cardamom, white pepper, cinnamon, bay leaves, cloves, barley, malt and woods. Very spicy finish. The Special Holiday Ale has got a very special and extraordinary taste and palate. Very interesting beer.

Big strong malt and hop aroma. Ruddy brown colour with great bubbly head. Nice choc and caramel flavours. Med to heavy creamy body with med carbonation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Creamy head over a black body. Heavy spice, but luckily also rich malts. Quite clean yeast buy full malts. Warming alcohol, cereal malts, foresty hops. Its just rich enough to withstand all those aniseed, clove and peppery spices. Fairly bitter and woody sweetness but a bit too spiced still in the end. American interpretation of a Belgian brown ale. But within that category its not so bad. (50cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

Bottle shared with friends. Color: dark brown beer with small carbonation and small brown head. Smell: herbal and malty nose with spices expression. Taste: malt presence with explosion of spices taste as clove and cinnamon and some licorice taste. Aftertaste: malty presence with good hops balance.

Rated on 01-09-2010 at Fort Wayne, IN Winter Gathering. This beer forms a small tan head with a long retention, opaque brown body, and spotty amounts of lacing. The Aroma is malty, berries and spicy. The Taste is sweet, quite malty, berries, and spicy. The Palate is tingly and this beer is medium-full bodied. Overall, this beer has a unique flavor and is worth trying.

Pour is dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is of toffee, nuts, molasses, and peat. Flavor is much like the aroma with some spice and dark fruit added. This is all over the place with spice, fruit, and sweet malts. Im not sure if it works.
A very nice pumpkin beer. The pumpkin is there, but understated. Lots of spices give this beer distinction, especially nutmeg.

Botella de 50 cl en el lupulo. 10-01-14 en el momento. Una auténtica mezcolanza de bayas y especias. Color caoba con toques rojizos y espuma beige muy poco persistente. Cuerpo medio bastante pastoso y con fino paso por boca. Aromas bastante hervaceos y especiados. Sabores dulces a bayas verdes y frescas con muy ligero Amargor final. Bastante buena aunque se hace un poco empalagosa sobre todo a medida que va calentando.

On 50 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Stovner. Black color, some foam. Aromas of malt, christmas spices & dreid fruits. Medium/full body & high complexity.SOme sweetness, good bitterness- balances well. Very enjoyable

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer bräunlicher Schaumkrone die aber schnell verschindet. 
Geruch röstmalzig süß, Gewürze. Geschmack röstmalzig, überreife Früchte, orientalisch würzig. Malzig klebrg.

Bottle 50cl. Small brown layer. Dark red brown color. A bit hazy. Aroma is orange, raisins, roasted chocolate malt and caraway. Taste is raisins, dark bread, sugar and chestnuts. A lot this one, but not too much.
MÃ¸rk med lettfarvet skum. Spennende krydret aroma, som passer etiketten. Varmt Ã¸stlig preg. Fyldig, myk, lett bitter. God sÃ¸dme. Fin lengde. God maltbase. (Hos Lene, 31.12.13)

Fine carbonation, almost creamy mouthfeel (though not that extreme). Holiday spices in moderation and overall smooth and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a muddy medium to dark brown. Minimal head. Aroma is sweet, quite malty, light spiced, what I believe is juniper, light roast, some chocolate, perhaps a bit of raisin, some other dark sugaryness - very interesting and unique. Flavor is similar, spiced, flowery, juniper still stands out to me, sugary caramel. Medium body. Creamy, little slick, sticky. Aroma is standout for me. Flavor still good just not quite balanced maybe. Dont really like the herbal bitterness. Overall I enjoyed it.

very light and sweet, which is a little surprising considering the dark color. caramel, spices, juniper, roast. unique aroma. 
Taste follows. very interesting. sweet, floral, dark fruit.
This beer is like my mind, theres a lot going on. (but in a good way)

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Lykkestund 3.juledag-13 når jeg åpnet denne (batch 440, brygget 270709 og bb. 270714: slow gusher, men etterpå var alt pure bliss! Som en vellagret portvin av beste merke, men lettere og allikevel med større munnfylde. Så avrundet og fløyelsmyk som en hermelinskåpe. Flaske fra batch 528 (brygget 050810, bb. 050815), nytt til siste dråpe 050615: viskøs, brunsvart med kort beige skum. Vidunderlig kompleks aroma og smak av krydder og lakris. delikat bitterhet og halvtørr avslutning. En seier for viljestyrken at jeg greide å lagre den så lenge.

Botella de 500ml. Copa Borgoña. Color marrón muy oscuro. La espuma, de minúscula burbuja forma una capa tupida, amplia y firme que deja amplios encajes en las paredes. El perfil aromático despliega notas intensas de malta caramelo y dulces, hierbas comino y anís- bosque bayas y frutos secos. Sabores de maltas tostadas, matices ahumados, de infusión de hierbas y frutos del bosque con melazas y azúcar moreno subyacentes. Cuerpo pleno y carbonatación moderada aunque algo chispeante. Paladar aterciopelado y textura densa. El bien integrado ABV se muestra como una cálida sensación azucarada. En el intermedio notas de chocolate fundido y fruta; así como trazos ásperos de frutos secos con sutiles matices especiados y picantes. Recuerdos de licor café y azúcar sin ser empalagosos- afloran en el dulce, tostado y malteado final. Frutos oscuros en el retrogusto. Una Winter Ale compleja y sabrosa, como debe ser!!
500ml bottle. Bourgogne Wine glass. Very dark brown color. Small bubbled foam, yellowish beige in color, forms a close, wide & sticky head & leaves wide lacings on sides. Aroma profile displays : Intense caramel malt & candies, herbal  cumin & anise-, forest, blackberries & dried nuts. Toasted flavors, smoky hues, herbal infusion & dark fruits, underneath molasses & brown sugar. Full body. Moderate but slight sparkling carbonation. Velvet palate & dense texture. Well integrated ABV appears as a kind warming sensation. Fudge chocolate & fruit notes in the middle as well as dried nut zest, subtle spiced & spicy hints. Memories of coffee liquor & sugar but no cloying- into a sweet toasted malt finish. Dark fruity aftertaste. Complex & flavorful as a Winter Ale should be!!

Dark brown body with a tiny head, ok lacing. Rather strong aroma with caramel, herbs, juniper berries and spices, also port wine, burnt sugar and brown sugar. Very sweet taste. Even though there are not much bitterness to balance, the sweetness, the spices ensure that the beer is not cloying. Maybe its because Im Norwegian, but I find the Norwegian contribution to the spice mix, the juniper berries, to be much more obvious than white sage and chestnuts. On the other hand Im not that familiar with the two latter ingredients, so they may be in there as well, as the stuff Ive labelled "herbs" and "spices" in my tasting notes. I also get caraway, anise seeds, dark caramel and hints of chocolate. Amazing mouthfeel, its the most creamy and smooth texture Ive ever experienced! The body is full and the carbonation is very soft. A wonderful beer! 
[50 cl bottle, batch 1023, enjoyed 3.5 months after brewing, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]
Bottle. Chestnut brown with a short tan head. Aroma is sweet dark fruit. Flavor is smoked oak, nutty, fruity heavy and spicy. Long strong fruity finish. Goes well with Tayto chilli crisps

dark brown with thick and small head. Aroma is oriental spices, fruit, cinnamon, ginger, roasted malt and caramel. very nice vinous mouth feel with very low carbonation, Aftertaste is sweet, spicy, orange and caramel. Overall: Very nice brew.

Pours a muddy murky brown with a small head (even with a vigorous pour) 

The aroma is really spice focused, plenty of juniper offered, plenty of pine and general Christmastime potpourri offered. Its a nice smell, very Christmasy, maybe not especially inviting as I generally dont want to eat or drink something with that much spice but yeah its a nice enough smelling beer. 

The flavor is pretty spicy, not unbearable but pretty focused around the sage and the juniper. Its got a nice sweetness & a cool brown sugar & toffee character. Its honestly a little sweeter than Id like it to be, but its got the spicy christmastime dessert thing in the bag for sure. 

Good, defiantly good but maybe not something Id go back for a second round on.

Very large and thick orange/beige head with dry fruits aromas. Dark body, no sediment. Taste shows light malt, hazelnut and raisins. Lovely balance with little hop or bitterness however. Would be a good pairing with the Xmas pudding.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

[My bottle (500ml) shared with HogTownHarry and R. -- c/o Glouglouburp] Pours a very deep ruby with a small lasting frothy tan head. Aroma of red wine, dark fruit, nuts, spices, light hops, brown sugar and more. Very tasty flavour follows the aroma and has a long spicy finish. Medium bodied. Syrupy mouthfeel. Really good in small quantities.

Draft at BrewDog Shepherds Bush. Pours dark brown with a red tinge with a moderately lived beige head. Aroma is chesnut, caramel, spice, mild chocolate and coffee and raisins. Flavour is a bit methanol. Not that bitter. No carbonation.
Dark ruby red, brown with small light brown foam head. Aroma is very nice, caramel and chessnut. Nice taste, bit too sweet, but fruity, chessnut and red fruit. A ver nice beer. (Velp 201312)

500ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Tiny creamy light brown head. Dark brown body which lets almost no light through. Herbal aroma of roasted malt, coffee, citrus and toffee. Very pleasant. Sweet on the tongue with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Creamy, delicious mouthfeel.
UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Brunlig farge med medium skum. Nydelig lukt, som en belgier. Tørket frukt i fleng. Smaken er meget god. Tørket frukt. Noe krydder og antydning til sjokolade. Fin munnfølelelse.
Pours very dark brown with tan head. Caramel and mild coffee aroma. Mild chocolate and less spicy taste than expected.
Bottle.Dark Brown colour with small head.Aroma is strong spicey with taste of x-mas spices and chocolate,nice sweet taste of cinnamon,raisins and rosted caramel and nuts really good x-mas beer.

Pours black with a brown head. Sounded like a thick pour. Not much on the nose. Thick mouth feel. Aroma of some caramel malts, some spice. Its okay, but a little bland for me. Maybe pour at a lower temp.

Dark red-brown color, golden head. Spicy nose, roasted malt, ginger, apple, raisins, hints of mint, sage and juniper. Chocolate malt taste, caramel, nuts, earthy. Quite sweet with a slightly bitter finish. Full body.

Keg at opening of the bar in Shepherds Bush. Short review due to session. Black with a foamy white head. Smell - lime and spearmint. Body medium and carbonation is low. Taste - urinal cake, mint, lime. Weird. Good in an interesting way.

Pours a clear dark brown with an inch of dark tanned head. Spicy aroma with juniper, anise, cinnamon and toasted malts. Taste is spicy at first then into dark malty sweetness and finished with hints of chocolate and a light bitterness. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

DWG; Pours dark brown with medium lasting, creamy light brown head. Nose fills with ginger, cardemomme, dark fruity, nutty and malty. Taste mirrors with caramell sweetness. Nicely balanced, low carbonation and oily texture. Dry, spicy lasting finish.

DWS My first beer this afternoon :) 
Medium brown colour, clear. Aroma is sweet, fruity...dry fruits and ginger. 
Sweet taste, prunes and spices. Bitter finish. 
All in all an interesting Holiday Ale :)
Had a bottle of this.It was bought on Vinmonopolet. Thick,full body,slightly alcoholic. One of the better in its style but I still do not enjoy the alcoholic aftertaste.

Bottle 0,5l. Pours darkest brown with tan head. Aroma of cola, toffee, nuts and molasses. Taste of toffee, treacle, mollasses, spices and sage.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fin duft av rosin og krydder. mørk gyllen kastanje farge. Lite skum. Fin smak av rosin og krydder.
Mørk brun med gulbrunt høyt skum som ligger godt. Gresskar, nøtter, urter og karamelllukt. Medium søt og medium bitter, litt salt. Medium kullsyre. Lang behagelig bitter avslutning

Pours dark brown, almost black. Had to pour quite vigorously to get a tiny bit of tan head (I swear, no pun intended). Quite dry. Very drinkable, but medium thick nonetheless. Low carbonation. Reminds me of a good porter, which surprised me - I was expecting an all out, crazy herb beer. Weak mint (sage?), malt, nutty, earthy aroma. Balanced sweet- and bitterness. A good beer. Hard to pick out the aromas.

Aroma av karamell og nøtter. Smaken er preget av brunsukker, honning, nøtter og en tanke brentmalt. Mye sødme her altså, men er relativt markant bitterhet balanserer det hele - særlig etter 1 år i kjelleren. Et øl som bedrer seg med lagring, altså, og generelt et av de bedre øl fra Nøgne Ø

Dark ruby color with one finger beige head. Aroma of caramel, candy sugar, chestnuts, honey, dark fruits. Taste is light sweet, light to medium bitter, nice dry aftertaste. Medium body, smooth texture, soft carbonation.
Brown beer with brownish head on top. Aroma has juniper berries, some roasted malts and nuts. Taste is roasted, nutty and there is nice bitterness at the end. Exciting beer.
Tap at Olutexpo 2013, Helsinki. Colour is dark brown with small slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Spices, sweetness, caramel and malts.

The juniper and spices come though on the nose. It is dark black looks like it might be unclouded but its so black you cant tell. Thick body light kind of medicinal bite in side this thick creamy flavor. Slight tang as it warms more and more is released. Great spice warming beer.

slunce ve skle 2013, poured from the bottle at the beergeek stall. sweet and sticky - some ginger and honey in the nose, some vanilla and a touch of nutmeg with a slight woody yeasty note in the finish

Bottle from Nøgne Ø at Swanze day. Pours a dark brown color with a large foamy light brown color. Aroma is dark fruits, plums and pear, Taste is dry, pears and plums cumin and cardemum? and cellar. axiting brew.

Bottle from Pivoteka Beergeek, Prague. Very dark brown color with thick beige head. Aroma of anise, ginger, licorice, cinnamon. Taste roasted malt, cinnamon, star anise, licorice, cardamon, juniper, roasted malt. Spicy finish. Wow, extremely tasty, amazing beer.

500 ml bottle poured a clear dark chestnut with a lasting tan head. Aromas of toffee, carmel, sage, juniper and a hint of nuts. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of carmel, toffee, sage, juniper and light nuttiness with a smooth lingering spiced finish.
Brown poor. Tastes of Christmas. Hot warm alcohol. Feels like nutmeg and spices Tasty well made beverage with a lot going on.

50cl, Nøgne Ø Edition, exclusive Norwegian collab. brew, with chestnuts, carraway and juniper berries, from The Bottle Shop Canterbury, very complex brew, spicy/sweet and slightly roasted/fruity, not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, nearly no head, good Winter brew, yet expensive!

Dark cloudy amber light carbonation. Aromas of juniper berry, lightly nutty, caramel, slight fruity hops which are almost blended in. Flavors of juniper, caramel, slight pepsi (thats right pepsi cola!), light hint of cherry, slight sage (well meshed with fruity flavors). Slight oak wood impression. Caraway didnt notice. Silky texture. Medium sweet. Leaves just a light almost flavorless bitter finish. Good complex stuff and fun finding the flavors. Well done. Bravo.

Sage? Why would you use sage in a beer? Youre just going to ruin it. 

Im quite sensitive to the taste of sage. I like it in pork dishes, and in pumpkin or butternut squash soup. 

That is all. 

Put it in beer, and youve done something wrong. 

That said, theres a good beer behind the sage. 

Liquorice, malt, other spices in the taste and long, dry finish. Remove the herbs and it might be a 4.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours a dark creamy chestnut brown and opaque. Nicely proportioned head. The nose is very faint indeed, just a hint of malt and perhaps spice. The taste is of liquorice and savoury maltiness. The palate is medium to full bodied with a long dry persistent finish. A really interesting beer.
aged 2 years in my cellar, bbe 2015. herb aroma. black/brown beer no head. a brown ale kind of backbone which floats the herb/berry aromas. balanced and nice tasting beer, would be good at xmas.
Bottle brewed 3.8.2010, batch 526. Dark reddish color, no head. Aroma is ginger, different spices, licorice. Taste is licorice, dark malts, hops, sage.

Refrigerated 0.5 L brown bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours dark brown with small off-white head which dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, medium body, super silky texture, and spruce aroma.  Taste is complex:  roasty, spruce, sage, salty, chestnuts, and a hint of anise.  Different, interesting, alcohol is well covered, but I would not  make this a go to brew.  No spruce.

This great beer was from the bottle sharing at Dark Lord Day in Munster, Indiana.  It plopped into my glass a near black with a big tan head.  Nose of roasted malts and spices with spruce most dominate . Full body.  Good rich mouthfeel .Flavor was really rich with chocolate and spruce again. Quite a beer.

Sampled at DLD 2013.  It poured a dark coffee brown color with a dark  head. The aroma was of licorice and spruce, with taste was the same. There was some dark unsweetened chocolate on the palate, but that was overpowered by the spruce. Great stuff.

shared by glubgonzo and/or inbreak , at rampkrot. 
pours brown, very small white foam . smell is reraly sweet, grainy. soft carbo , sugary , sweet. sligthly medicinal .
